Carefully place flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon into a sifter and sift over wet ingredients and stir.","5. Add apples and oats and stir again lightly until just combined. Spoon into muffin tin until each liner is filled to the very top. Sprinkle oats on top (optional).","6. Bake for 18-22 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely and then store in an air-tight container and refrigerate to ensure freshness."]
907.title: Vegan Pumpkin Apple Muffins

908.ingredients: [1 1/4 cup high-quality semisweet or dark chocolate chips  (dairy-free for vegan), 2 heaping cups high-quality white chocolate  (dairy-free for vegan), 1 1/2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice, 1/4 cup dried cranberries, 1/4 cup raw or roasted pumpkin seeds, 1/4 cup raw almonds]
908.recipe: ["1. In the microwave or over a double boiler, melt the dark chocolate, stirring occasionally. Once melted, pour over a cookie sheet and spread until even – should be a fairly thin layer.","2. Place pan in freezer to harden for at least 10-15 minutes.","3. Rinse your bowl clean and melt the white chocolate chips, stirring occasionally. Once melted, remove from heat and add pumpkin pie spice. Stir until thoroughly mixed.","4. Remove pan from freezer and pour white chocolate over the top of the dark chocolate, moving quickly to spread it carefully in an even layer directly on top. Get the edges as close to lined up as possible.","5. Quickly sprinkle on almonds, pumpkin seeds and cranberries. Pop in freezer for another 10-15 minutes.","6. Then break into pieces and store in an airtight container or bag. Refrigerate to keep fresh for longer."]
908.title: Pumpkin Bark

909.ingredients: [1 cup light vanilla soy milk, 1 tsp apple cider vinegar, 3/4 scant cup granulated sugar, 2 medium peaches (peeled, pitted and finely pureed), 1/3 cup canola oil, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 1/4 cup all-purpose or pastry flour*, 3/4 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1 pinch salt, 10-12 ice cream cake cones, 1/2 cup non-dairy butter (room temp // like Earth Balance* // 1 stick equals 1/2 cup), 4 Tbsp vegan honey such as Bee Free  (alternatively, use agave nectar), 1.5 – 2 cups powdered sugar, 1 Tbsp almond milk  (or other non-dairy milk)]
909.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (176 C).","2. Whisk together the soy milk and vinegar in a large bowl, and set aside for a few minutes to curdle. Add the sugar, oil, and vanilla extract to the soy milk mixture and beat until foamy. Add peach puree and stir.","3. Next, carefully add flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt to a sifter and sift over wet ingredients. Beat until no large lumps remain.","4. Place ice cream cones in a muffin pan and carefully scoop batter into the cones, filling almost all the way full.","5. Bake for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.","6. Transfer to a flat surface and let cool completely. Rinse your bowl out while the cupcakes are baking to make buttercream frosting in."]
909.title: Vegan Peach Cupcakes with Honey Buttercream Frosting

910.ingredients: [1 1/2 cups warm water, 3 cups unbleached flour, 1/4 cup whole wheat flour, 1/2 Tbsp salt, 3/4 Tbsp fast-acting yeast (1 pack yields ~3/4 Tbsp), 1/4 cup raisins, 1/4 cup raw pumpkin seeds, 1/4 cup raw almonds]
910.recipe: ["1. Combine warm water (like bath water, or 110 degrees F / 43 C), yeast, salt and flours in a large mixing bowl and stir. The result will be a sticky, rough dough. If using a stand mixer, beat at medium speed for about a minute. Otherwise just use a spoon to stir until well combined.","2. Lift the dough out and lightly grease the bowl with nonstick spray or olive oil. Cover and let rise in the refrigerator for two hours. Alternatively, let rise for 2 hours at room temp and 2 hours in the fridge. I went straight for the fridge to save time.","3. While the dough is rising, soak the raisins by placing them in a small bowl and covering with water. Allow to soak for 20 minutes, then drain, pat dry, and set aside. This helps prevent the raisins from popping out of the bread or burning.","4. Once risen, lightly sprinkle the dough with flour and transfer to a floured work surface. Knead a few times and then add pumpkin seeds, almonds and raisins. Knead until just combined, trying to keep the add-ins on the inside of the loaf, or else they’ll get too crisp while baking.","5. Place on parchment-lined baking stone or lightly greased baking sheet. Sift a light coating of flour over the top; to help keep the dough moist. Let rest for 45-60 minutes.","6. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (232 C) while the dough rests. Place a metal or cast iron pan (not glass, Pyrex, or ceramic) on the lowest oven rack, and have 1 cup of hot water ready.","7. When ready to bake, slash the bread 2 or 3 times with a knife, making a cut about ½-inch deep.","8. Place bread in oven and carefully pour hot water into the shallow pan on the rack beneath. Expect it to bubble and steam; then close oven door quickly.","9. Bake the bread for 25 to 35 minutes, or until deep, golden brown.","10. Remove the bread from the oven and cool on a rack. Store leftovers in a plastic bag at room temp."]
910.title: 7-Ingredient Muesli Bread

911.ingredients: [1 very ripe medium banana, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 batch  flax egg (1 Tbsp (7 g) flaxseed meal + 2 ½ Tbsp (37 ml) water as original recipe is written), 1 pinch salt, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 Tbsp avocado oil (optional), 2/3 scant cup dairy-free milk  (I used almond), 1 1/2 Tbsp cocoa powder, 1/3 cup rolled oats  (or gluten-free oats), 1/4 cup whole wheat or unbleached flour  (or sub other flour), 1/4 cup no-bake cookie sprinkles*  (plus more for topping- 2 Tbsp as original recipe is written)]
911.recipe: ["1. *To prepare no-bake cookie sprinkles, pulse 9 dates, 1/4 cup oats, 1 1/2 Tbsp natural salted peanut butter, and 1/4 cup chocolate chips in food processor until small crumbles remain and transfer to a bowl (amounts as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size).","2. Preheat a skillet to medium-low heat and prepare flax egg by mixing flaxseed meal and water and letting set for 3-5 minutes.","3. Mash your very ripe banana with baking powder.","4. Add flax egg, oil, salt, vanilla, and almond milk and stir.","5. Stir in oats, flour and cocoa powder until just combined.","6. Add no bake cookie sprinkles and fold gently. Add more almond milk if too thick.","7. Scoop 1/4 cup measurements onto lightly greased griddle.","8. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side. Be careful not to burn – they will be slightly soft in the middle from the banana.","9. Serve with another healthy scoop of no-bake cookie sprinkles – in between each layer if you dare."]
911.title: No-Bake Cookie Pancakes

912.ingredients: [1 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1/4 cup apple juice, 2 tablespoons cider vinegar, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 dash black pepper, 1 small head green or Napa cabbage, 1 orange or red bell pepper, 1 Gala or Fuji apple, 1/4 cup sliced almonds]
912.recipe:
["1. Whisk together dressing ingredients.
2. Shred or thinly slice cabbage.
3. Cut apple and pepper into small chunks.
4. Place cabbage, apples, pepper and almonds in large bowl.
5. Drizzle with dressing and toss."]
912.title: Bell Pepper and Apple Coleslaw

913.ingredients: [1 1/2 cups brown rice, 3 cups water, 1/4 cup almonds (sliced), 1 teaspoon parsley (dried), 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper]
913.recipe: ["1. Place all ingredients in a rice cooker and cook until the water evaporates, about 30 minutes.","2. Fluff cooked rice with a fork."]
913.title: Brown Rice Pilaf

914.ingredients: [1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 teaspoons white wine vinegar, 1/2 cup apple juice, 1 tablespoon tomato basil garlic seasoning blend, no-salt, 1/2 cup almond slivers, 2 tomatoes, coarsely chopped, 1/2 yellow bell pepper, chopped, 1/2 cucumber, peeled, chopped, 3 green onions, sliced, 2 15½ oz cans cannellini (white) beans, no-salt-added, drained, and rinsed, Large lettuce leaves (Boston, Bibb,or romaine)]
914.recipe: ["1. Whisk together dressing ingredients in a small bowl.","2. In a small sauté pan, toast almond slivers until golden.","3. Remove from pan and let cool.","4. In a medium bowl, toss dressing with all ingredients except lettuce.","5. Refrigerate until ready to serve.","6. To serve, place lettuce leaves on individual plates; top with salad."]
914.title: Garden Cannellini Bean Salad

915.ingredients: [3 cups green beans (fresh, cut into 1-inch lengths), 2 carrot (cut into thick strips), 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 onion (large, sliced), 1 pound mushroom (fresh, sliced), 1 teaspoon lemon pepper seasoning, 1/2 tablespoon garlic salt, 1/4 cup almonds (toasted, slivered)]
915.recipe: ["1. Place green beans and carrots in 1 inch of boiling water. Cover, and cook until tender but still firm. Drain.\n2. Add oil to heated skillet. Sauté onions and mushrooms until almost tender. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 3 minutes. Stir in green beans, carrots, Lemon pepper, and garlic salt. Cover, and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat."]
915.title: Green Bean and Mushroom Medley

916.ingredients: [2 cups crispy rice or wheat cereal squares, 1/2 cup roasted whole pumpkin seeds, 1/3 cup slivered almonds, 1/2 cup dried cranberries, 1/2 cup raisins]
916.recipe: ["Wash hands with soap and water.","Mix all ingredients together and serve."]
916.title: Roasted Pumpkin Seed Snack Mix

917.ingredients: [3/4 cup wheat and barley nugget cereal, 1/4 cup bran cereal (100%), 2 tablespoons sunflower seeds (2 teaspoons, toasted), 2/3 tablespoon almonds (2 teaspoons, toasted, sliced), 1 tablespoon raisins, 1/2 cup banana (sliced), 1 cup strawberries (sliced), 1 cup yogurt (raspberry or strawberry, low-fat)]
917.recipe: ["1. Mix the wheat and barley nugget cereal, bran cereal, sunflower seeds, and almonds in a medium bowl.","2. Add the raisins, the bananas, and half of the strawberries.","3. Gently stir in the yogurt and divide between two bowls.","4. Scatter the remaining strawberries over the top and enjoy!"]
917.title: Springtime Cereal

918.ingredients: [1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 1 1/4 cups celery (finely chopped, with leaves), 1 1/2 cups onion (finely chopped), 1 cup water, 1/2 cup orange juice, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 dash hot sauce, 1 cup white rice (long-grain, uncooked), 1/4 cup almonds (slivered)]
918.recipe: ["1. Heat oil in medium saucepan. Add celery and onions and saute until tender, about 10 minutes.","2. Add water, juices, and hot sauce. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice and bring back to a boil. Let stand covered until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.","3. Stir in almonds. Serve immediately as a side dish for a fish entree."]
918.title: Sunshine Rice

919.ingredients: [1½ Tbsp(22 mL)Asian sesame paste, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)white miso paste, 2 tsp(10 g)doubanjiang chili bean paste, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened almond milk, 1medium shallot, minced, 2cloves garlic, minced, ½ tspfreshly grated ginger, 1.7 oz(50 g)shiitake mushrooms, sliced, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 2cups(480 mL)low-sodium vegetable stock, 4heads Shanghai bok choy, halved, 5.2 oz(150 g)fried tofu puffs, 1 tsp(5 mL)sesame oil, 12.6 oz(360 g)pre-cooked udon noodles, ½medium carrot, julienned, ½cup(45 g)fresh bean sprouts, black sesame seeds, crispy chili oil, sliced green onion]
919.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, mix the Asian sesame paste, miso paste, bean paste, and almond milk.","2. Fry the shallot, garlic, ginger, and shiitake in oil in sauté pan on medium-high for 5 - 7 minutes.","3. Add the stock and miso mixture to the pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook uncovered for 5 - 7 minutes.","4. In the last 30 seconds add bok choy, tofu, and sesame oil.","5. Meanwhile, cook the noodles separately for 30 seconds, or according to the package instruction. Drain and add to the bowls.","6. Pour the soup over the noodles and garnish with desired toppings. Enjoy!"]
919.title: Spicy Miso Sesame Ramen

920.ingredients: [2 tsp(4 g)espresso powder, ¼cup(60 mL)boiling water, ⅓cup(80 mL)cold water, ½ tspalmond extract, 1cup(232 g)plain vegan cream cheese†, ⅓cup(80 mL)sweetened condensed coconut milk, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 12digestive cookies, 1 tsp(2 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder]
920.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, dissolve the espresso powder in the boiling water. Then add the cold water and almond extract and mix again.","2. To a medium bowl, add the cream cheese, condensed milk, and vanilla extract. Use a electric hand mixer* to mix until smooth.","3. Break one or two cookies into a few pieces, dropping them into the espresso mixture. Then immediately scoop it out and transfer it to the bottom of your serving cup. Use a spoon to crush the cookies in the cup.","4. Spread a layer of cream (about 3 Tbsp) on top, followed by some more cookie pieces that have been dipped in the espresso mixture.","5. Add a final layer of cream, and then sift some cocoa powder on top. Enjoy right away, or let it chill for 1 hour in the fridge to let the flavours meld."]
920.title: Tiramisu-Inspired Trifle

921.ingredients: [1cup(81 g)rolled oats, 2cups(480 mL)unsweetened almond milk†, 1medium banana, sliced, ½cup(75 g)frozen blueberries, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, ⅛ tspalmond extract (optional), 1medium banana, sliced, ½cup(75 g)fresh blueberries, ⅔cup(160 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt†, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)almond butter, ground cinnamon, sliced roasted almonds]
921.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan, add the oats, milk, banana, blueberries, and flaxseeds. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce to a simmer for 7 minutes, stirring on occasion to prevent burning.","2. Take the pan off the heat and stir in the maple syrup, vanilla, and almond extract.","3. Divide the oatmeal between the bowls and top with banana slices, fresh blueberries, yogurt, and almond butter. Enjoy!"]
921.title: Blueberry Almond Oatmeal

922.ingredients: [1cup(81 g)rolled oats, 1½cups(360 mL)unsweetened almond milk, ½cup(120 mL)water, 1vegetable bouillon cube, crushed, 2 tsp(10 g)diced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, 1 tsp(3 g)Mexican spice mix, ¾cup(124 g)canned corn, drained, ¾cup(129 g)cooked black beans, ¾cup(176 g)salsa, ½avocado, sliced, fresh cilantro, hot sauce, lime slices]
922.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan, add the oats, milk, water, bouillon, chipotle, and spice mix. Bring to a gentle boil. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring often.","2. Meanwhile, to a medium pan on high heat, add the corn and cook for 3 - 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned. Set aside.","3. When the oatmeal is cooked to your liking, add the black beans. When heated through, remove from the heat.","4. Divide the oatmeal between your bowls. Top with a generous portion of salsa, corn, and slices of avocado. Drizzle with fresh lime juice and desired garnishes. Enjoy!"]
922.title: Chipotle Spiced Black Bean Oatmeal

923.ingredients: [1cup(81 g)rolled oats, 2cups(480 mL)unsweetened almond milk†, ⅓cup(35 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, 2 tsp(2 g)instant coffee granules, 1.7 oz(50 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, roughly chopped, divided, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 1 pinchsalt (optional) , 2small bananas, sliced, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)hazelnut butter, 2 Tbsp(14 g)roasted hazelnuts, chopped (optional) ]
923.recipe: ["1. To a saucepan, add the oats, milk, cacao powder, and instant coffee. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce to a simmer for 7 - 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Take the pot off the heat and stir in half of the chopped chocolate and all of the maple syrup and salt.","2. Divide the oatmeal between the bowls. Top with banana, yogurt, hazelnut butter, hazelnuts, and the remaining chopped chocolate. Enjoy!"]
923.title: Mocha Hazelnut Oatmeal

924.ingredients: [3cups(243 g)rolled oats, 1cup(143 g)raw almonds, chopped, ½cup(72 g)raw pumpkin seeds, ½cup(62 g)raw sunflower seeds, ¾cup(56 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, ½cup(120 mL)maple syrup, ¼cup(60 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, ¼ tspsalt, dairy-free dark chocolate chips, dried cranberries, hemp seeds, whole chia seeds]
924.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C) and line a baking tray. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, almonds, seeds, and coconut.","2. Pour the maple syrup, coconut oil, and salt over the oat mixture and toss it to coat. Transfer to the baking tray and bake on the centre rack of the oven for 60 - 70 minutes*, or until lightly golden. Stir every 15 - 20 minutes.","3. When removed from the oven, let cool completely. It will continue to harden as it cools. If adding any dried fruits, stir it in now, then transfer the granola to an airtight container or large glass storage jar. Enjoy!"]
924.title: Toasted Coconut & Almond Granola

925.ingredients: [3ripe bananas, mashed, ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened almond milk, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)melted coconut oil, 1½cups(156 g)oat flour†, 1cup(116 g)chickpea flour†, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, 1 Tbsp(3 g)instant coffee granules, 2 tsp(7 g)baking powder, ¼ tspsalt, 2 tsp(9 g)granulated sugar, ¼ tspground cinnamon, 12raw pecans]
925.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C), and lightly grease the wells of a muffin tin.","2. To a large bowl, add the bananas and mash until puréed. Then add the milk and oil and mix well.","3. Add the remaining muffin ingredients and mix until there are no lumps left. Fill the wells of the muffin tin until ¾ full.","4. In a small bowl, combine the sugar and cinnamon for the topping and sprinkle it on the muffins. Add a pecan to the top of each muffin.","5. Bake on the centre rack in the preheated oven for 16 - 18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the muffin tins, and enjoy!"]
925.title: Banana Coffee Muffins

926.ingredients: [1cup(200 g)uncooked pearl couscous, 2 tsp(10 mL)olive oil, 2cups(328 g)cooked chickpeas, 2cupscherry tomato, quartered, ½ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper, ½cucumber, sliced into half-moons, ¼cup(34 g)sliced black olives, 3 Tbsp(6 g)fresh mint leaves, chopped, 2 Tbsp(3 g)fresh basil, chopped, 2 Tbsp(2 g)fresh parsley, chopped (optional) , ¼cup(32 g)roasted almonds, chopped (optional) , 3 Tbsp(45 mL)extra virgin olive oil, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)red wine vinegar, ½lemon, juiced, ¼ tsppaprika powder]
926.recipe: ["1. Cook the couscous according to the package instructions, then drain.","2. Meanwhile, to a medium pan on medium-high heat, add the oil, chickpeas, tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Cook for about 5 - 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat.","3. In a small bowl, mix together the ingredients for the dressing.","4. To a large bowl, add the drained couscous, tomato and chickpea mixture, cucumber slices, olives, and fresh herbs. Add the dressing, toss to combine, spinkle over the almonds, and enjoy!"]
926.title: Warm Pearl Couscous Salad

927.ingredients: [2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, 1cup(150 g)frozen pineapple chunks, ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, ½cup(52 g)frozen cucumber slices, ½avocado, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)pure vanilla extract, fresh berries, unsweetened shredded coconut, whole chia seeds]
927.recipe: ["1. Add all of the smoothie ingredients to a blender.","2. Blend on high until everything smooth.","3. Pour into bowls and add desired toppings. Alternatively, pour into a glass and drink as is. Enjoy!"]
927.title: The Extraordinary Green Smoothie Bowl

928.ingredients: [1apple, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)water, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup, ½ tspground cinnamon, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, ½cup(40 g)rolled oats, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(10 g)raisins, 1 Tbsp(10 g)whole chia seeds, 1 Tbsp(7 g)chopped roasted walnuts, ½ tspground cinnamon, ½ tsppure vanilla extract, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt]
928.recipe: ["1. Cut just over half of the apple into bite-sized cubes, and add these to a medium pan. Mince or grate the other half of the apple and add to a mason jar or airtight container.","2. To the pan, add the water, maple syrup, and cinnamon. Cook over medium-high heat, and allow the apples to soften for about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and let cool.","3. Add all of the other ingredients to the jar, and mix to combine.  Add the cooked apple chunks to the top. Cover and let it sit overnight in the fridge. The next morning, top with yogurt and enjoy!"]
928.title: Apple Pie Overnight Oats

929.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(7 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, ¼ tspalmond extract, ¼cup(65 g)cherry pie filling, ⅓cup(80 mL)unsweetened coconut yogurt, chocolate shavings, fresh cherry]
929.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, mix the oats, milk, flaxseeds, almond butter, cocoa, and almond extract.","2. Spoon the mixture into a mason jar, alternating with spoonfuls of the cherry pie filling. Cover and place in the fridge overnight.","3. In the morning, top with yogurt and other desired toppings and enjoy!"]
929.title: Black Forest Overnight Oats

930.ingredients: [1½cups(207 g)all-purpose flour, 3 Tbsp(20 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, ¼cup(45 g)brown sugar, ¼cup(56 g)granulated sugar, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 tsp(7 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, ¼ tspground ginger, ¼ tspsalt, ⅛ tspground cloves (optional) , ⅛ tspground cardamom (optional), 1cup(96 g)almond flour†, ½cup(58 g)raw walnuts, chopped, ½cup(74 g)dried figs, chopped, ½cup(84 g)dairy-free dark chocolate chips, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk, ⅓cup(80 mL)vegetable oil]
930.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and lightly grease a muffin tin. To a large bowl, add all of the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.","2. Then add the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Spoon the mixture evenly into the wells of the muffin tin. For decoration, you could add some chopped nuts and dried fruits on top of the muffins before they go into the oven. This is optional.","3. Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 20 - 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean. Let cool, and enjoy!"]
930.title: Spiced Walnut & Fig Muffins

931.ingredients: [2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 5.2 oz(150 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, broken into pieces†, 3 Tbsp(41 g)refined coconut oil†, ½cup(90 g)brown sugar, lightly packed, ⅓cup(43 g)roasted almonds, coarsely chopped, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 1cup(138 g)all-purpose flour†, ½ tspbaking powder, ½ tspsalt, flaked sea salt]
931.recipe: ["1. In a small bowl, mix together the flaxseeds and water. Set aside.","2. Fill a saucepan halfway with water and bring to a boil. Place a large heat-safe bowl on top of the saucepan. Add the chocolate and coconut oil, mixing until it's all melted.","3. Then add the brown sugar and mix well. Remove the bowl from the saucepan. Be careful as the bowl will be hot.","4. To the same bowl, add the flaxseed mixture, almonds, and vanilla. Stir to combine.","5. Place a sieve over the bowl, and sift in the flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir until just combined, careful not to over-mix. Let the dough rest at room temperature for 15 minutes.","6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.","7. Scoop up about 1½ Tbsp fo the dough and roll into little balls with your hands. The cookies don't spread much on their own, so place them on the baking tray and gently press the dough down to create little disks about 1 cm thick. Leave about 5 cm between each cookie on the tray.","8. To decorate, gently press a couple of small pieces of chopped chocolate and chopped almonds to the top of each cookie before baking in the oven for 10 - 11 minutes.","9. When the cookies are removed from the oven, sprinkle with some sea salt, if desired. Let cool on the baking tray for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy!"]
931.title: Almond Brownie Cookies

932.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)water, 2ripe bananas, 1½cups(360 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 2cups(162 g)rolled oats, 2 tsp(5 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, ½ tspsalt, ⅓cup(36 g)raw pecans, roughly chopped, ¾cup(112 g)fresh blueberries, ¾cup(114 g)fresh strawberries, thinly sliced , almond butter, fresh blueberries, maple syrup, unsweetened soy yogurt]
932.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and lightly grease a 9 x 12 inch (23 x 31 cm) baking dish.","2. To a large bowl, add the flaxseeds and water. Mix and let rest for about 5 minutes to gel.","3. To the large bowl, add the bananas and mash well. Then add the milk and vanilla, and stir to combine.","4. Then add all the oats, cinnamon, baking powder, salt, and pecans. Mix.","5. Gently fold in the blueberries and strawberries.","6. Pour the mixture into the baking dish, and spread it out evenly. If desired, decorate the top with some more strawberry slices, blueberries, and raw pecans. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 35 - 40 minutes, or until firm and lightly golden on the top.","7. When removed from the oven, allow it to cool for a few minutes before slicing. Add desired toppings, and enjoy!"]
932.title: Baked Berry & Pecan Oatmeal

933.ingredients: [1½cups(285 g)uncooked brown rice, soaked overnight†, 1⅔cups(399 mL)canned light coconut milk, 6cardamom pods, cracked (optional), 1vegetable bouillon cube, crushed , 1medium broccoli, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1medium onion, cut into bite-sized pieces , 2parsnips, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1½cups(297 g)cooked brown lentils, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)olive oil, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cumin, 1 tsp(3 g)garlic powder, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, ½ tspsalt, ½ tspground black pepper, ¼ tspcayenne pepper, ½lime, juiced, ⅓cup(80 mL)tahini, ¼cup(60 mL)water, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)sambal oelek, 2 tsp(10 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 2 tsp(10 mL)agave syrup, ½ tsponion powder, lime slices, medium carrot, red bell pepper, roasted almonds]
933.recipe: ["1. To a medium pot, add the rice, coconut milk, cardamom, and bouillon. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook covered until the rice is tender and all the liquid has been absorbed about 15 - 20 minutes.","2. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). To a parchment-lined baking tray, add the broccoli, onion, parsnip, lentils, oil, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper. Toss together, and spread out evenly.","3. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 20 minutes, stirring once halfway.","4. When cooked, remove the rice from heat. Fluff with a fork, remove the cardamom pods, cover with a lid, and let rest for 5 minutes.","5. Prepare the sauce by combining the lime juice, tahini, water, sambal, soy sauce, agave syrup, and onion powder in a mason jar. Shake or stir to combine into a smooth sauce.","6. To assemble, layer rice on the bottom of a bowl. Top with a generous heap of roasted vegetables and lentils. Add some (optional) fresh cut-up veggies of your choosing, drizzle the tahini sambal sauce on top, and enjoy!"]
933.title: Coconut Roasted Lentil Nourish Bowl

934.ingredients: [½cup(72 g)raw almonds, 1cup(150 g)sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained, ½cup(120 mL)oil from jar of sun-dried tomatoes, ⅓cup(8 g)fresh basil, packed, 2cloves garlic, 1 Tbsp(2 g)nutritional yeast flakes, ½lemon, juiced , ½ tspsalt, ¼ tspground black pepper]
934.recipe: ["1. Heat a small pan over medium-high heat, and toast the almonds for 4 - 5 minutes, stirring throughout.","2. Add the toasted almonds and all the remaining ingredients to a food processor, and blend. Enjoy with crackers or as a spread on your favourite sandwich!"]
934.title: Vegan Red Pesto

935.ingredients: [2½cups(202 g)rolled oats, 1cup(70 g)puffed quinoa, ½cup(72 g)raw almonds, coarsely chopped, ½cup(38 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, ½cup(72 g)roasted pumpkin seeds, ¼cup(45 g)brown sugar, ½ tspground cinnamon, ¼cup(60 mL)vegetable oil, ¼cup(60 mL)maple syrup, ¼cup(60 mL)almond butter, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¾ tspsalt, 2 Tbsp(20 g)hemp seeds, ½cup(80 g)dried mango, thinly sliced]
935.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 320°F (160°C). To a large bowl, add the oats, puffed quinoa, almonds, coconut, pumpkin seeds, brown sugar, and cinnamon, and give it a stir.","2. To a separate medium bowl, add the oil, syrup, almond butter, vanilla, and salt. Whisk until it's all combined into a smooth caramel-like sauce.","3. Pour this wet mix over the dry mix, and stir until coated.","4. Transfer to a large lined baking tray and spread it out. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 30 minutes, or until lightly golden, stopping stir once halfway.","5. Remove from the oven and allow it to cool. It continues to harden as it cools. Add the hemp seeds and dried mango, and toss.","6. When completely cooled, transfer the granola to a storage container. Enjoy with fruit, and yogurt or milk for breakfast, or as a snack!"]
935.title: Crunchy Almond & Mango Granola

936.ingredients: [½cup(50 g)raw pecans, ⅔cup(87 g)dried apricots, 1cup(81 g)rolled oats, ½cup(48 g)almond flour†, ½ tspground cinnamon, 1 Tbsp(6 g)orange zest†, 1 pinchsalt, 1cup(240 mL)peanut butter, ½cup(120 mL)maple syrup, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 2.6 oz(75 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, ¼ tspflaked sea salt]
936.recipe: ["1. Add the pecans to a pan on medium-high heat and toast for 3 - 5 minutes, or until they become aromatic. Stir often.","2. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a 10 x 7 inch (26 x 17 cm) baking dish with parchment paper.","3. Add the apricots and toasted pecans to a food processor and blitz into small chunks.","4. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl, along with the oats, almond flour, cinnamon, orange zest (save a bit for garnish!), and salt. Stir well.","5. Then add the peanut butter, maple syrup, and vanilla. Mix again.","6. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Press down as firmly as possible, levelling it all out.","7. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, or until the top is lightly golden. Then let cool for a few minutes before removing from the baking dish to cool completely.","8. Meanwhile, melt the chocolate in a microwave or on the stove, using a double boiler. Drizzle it over the bars.","9. Sprinkle on some sea salt and reserved orange zest. Cut into 8 squares or about 10 bars, and enjoy!"]
936.title: Orange High-Energy Oat Bars

937.ingredients: [½cup(50 g)raw pecans, ⅔cup(87 g)dried apricots, 1cup(81 g)rolled oats, ½cup(48 g)almond flour†, ½ tspground cinnamon, 1 Tbsp(6 g)orange zest†, 1 pinchsalt, 1cup(240 mL)peanut butter, ½cup(120 mL)maple syrup, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 2.6 oz(75 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, ¼ tspflaked sea salt]
937.recipe: ["1. Add the pecans to a pan on medium-high heat and toast for 3 - 5 minutes, or until they become aromatic. Stir often.","2. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a 10 x 7 inch (26 x 17 cm) baking dish with parchment paper.","3. Add the apricots and toasted pecans to a food processor and blitz into small chunks.","4. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl, along with the oats, almond flour, cinnamon, orange zest (save a bit for garnish!), and salt. Stir well.","5. Then add the peanut butter, maple syrup, and vanilla. Mix again.","6. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Press down as firmly as possible, levelling it all out.","7. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, or until the top is lightly golden. Then let cool for a few minutes before removing from the baking dish to cool completely.","8. Meanwhile, melt the chocolate in a microwave or on the stove, using a double boiler. Drizzle it over the bars.","9. Sprinkle on some sea salt and reserved orange zest. Cut into 8 squares or about 10 bars, and enjoy!"]
937.title: Orange High-Energy Oat Bars

938.ingredients: [¾cup(124 g)chopped mango, ½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened coconut milk beverage†, 1 Tbsp(10 g)whole chia seeds, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)maple syrup (optional) , ½ tsppure vanilla extract, almond butter, mango, toasted coconut flakes, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
938.recipe: ["1. Add all the ingredients to a mason jar or airtight container. Mix to combine.","2. Add a lid onto the container, and let sit overnight in the fridge.","3. The next morning, add your desired toppings and enjoy!"]
938.title: Tropical Mango Coconut Overnight Oats

939.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter,  1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 1 Tbsp(9 g)chopped dairy-free dark chocolate, chocolate shavings, fresh raspberries, medium banana, roasted almonds, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
939.recipe: ["1. Combine all ingredients in a mason jar or airtight container and let sit overnight in the fridge.","2. The next morning, top with desired toppings. To make this a complete meal, add a handful of fresh fruit and/or plant-based yogurt to the top. Enjoy!"]
939.title: Almond Chocolate Overnight Oats

940.ingredients: [½cup(40 g)rolled oats, ½cup(120 mL)unsweetened soy milk, 1 Tbsp(7 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegan nutella, 1 Tbsp(9 g)chopped dairy-free dark chocolate, 1 pinchflaked sea salt (optional), almond butter, chocolate shavings, fresh strawberries, unsweetened coconut yogurt]
940.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients in a mason jar or airtight container and let sit overnight in the fridge.","2. The next morning, top with desired toppings. To make this a complete meal, top with some fresh fruit and plant-based yogurt. Enjoy!"]
940.title: Vegan 'Nutella' Overnight Oats

941.ingredients: [1head garlic, 1 tsp(5 mL)olive oil, 2cups(370 g)cooked quinoa, 1cup(164 g)cooked chickpeas, 1red bell pepper, chopped, 1yellow bell pepper, chopped, 1medium tomato, chopped, 1stalk green onion, thinly sliced, ⅓cucumber, diced, ¼cup(40 g)dried cranberries, chopped , ¼cup(38 g)kalamata olives, chopped, ½cup(65 g)roasted almonds, chopped, 2lemons, juiced, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)extra virgin olive oil, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)tahini, 1 tsp(5 mL)sodium-reduced soy sauce, 1 tsp(5 mL)balsamic vinegar, 1 tsp(2 g)onion powder, 1 pinchsalt, 1 pinchground black pepper, fresh basil, fresh parsley]
941.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). Cut the top ½ cm off the head of garlic to expose the cloves, and place it on a baking tray. Drizzle with oil and roast for 20 minutes, or until golden and fragrant.","2. Meanwhile, prep the veggies. To a large bowl, add the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, chopped veggies, cranberries, and olives. Toss to combine.","3. Remove the roasted cloves of garlic from the skin and place in a bowl, mash with a fork, and then add the remaining dressing ingredients. Stir. Pour dressing over the salad and toss. Top with the roasted almonds, and enjoy!"]
941.title: Quinoa Salad with Roasted Garlic Dressing

942.ingredients: [½cup(120 mL)almond butter, 2 Tbsp(13 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)unsweetened soy milk]
942.recipe: ["1. Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl, and enjoy as a spread on toast, or as a dip for fresh fruit."]
942.title: 2-Minute Chocolate Almond Spread

943.ingredients: [1¼cups(162 g)roasted almonds, 3soft Medjool dates, pits removed, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)melted coconut oil, 2 Tbsp(18 g)buckwheat flour, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 3 Tbsp(21 g)ground flaxseeds, 6 Tbsp(90 mL)water, 1cup(130 g)roasted almonds, ½cup(112 g)granulated sugar, ½cup(114 g)margarine, ⅓cup(46 g)all-purpose flour, ½cup(62 g)fresh raspberries, 2rhubarb stalks, peeled, thinly sliced , powdered sugar]
943.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven the 350°F (180°C). For the crust, combine the almonds, dates, coconut oil, buckwheat flour, and vanilla in a food processor. Blend into a crumb.","2. Transfer the mix to a parchment-lined tart 10 inch (22 cm) spring form pan. Press into the pan using your fingers*.","3. For the filling, mix the flaxseeds and water in a small bowl and set aside to gel.","4. In the now empty food processor, combine the almonds, sugar, margarine, and flour. Blend into a paste.","5. Add the flaxseed mixture and combine.","6. Pour this filling into the prepared crust and top with the raspberries and rhubarb.","7. Bake in the centre rack of the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, or until the crust starts to turn golden at the edges.","8. Remove from the oven, and let cool for a few minutes before serving. Dust with powdered sugar if desired, and enjoy!"]
943.title: Almond Tart with Raspberries & Rhubarb

944.ingredients: [1cup(190 g)soft Medjool dates, pits removed, 2cups(162 g)rolled oats, 1cup(240 mL)almond butter, ¼cup(28 g)ground flaxseeds, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1½cups(360 mL)unsweetened soy yogurt, 1cup(150 g)stewed berries]
944.recipe: ["1. In a food processor, blend the dates until smooth.","2. Add the oats, almond butter, ground flaxseed, and cinnamon. Blend again until well combined, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed.","3. Transfer the mix to an 11 x 7 inch (18 x 28cm) parchment-lined baking dish and press firmly into the base of the dish.","4. Top with the yogurt and spread out evenly.","5. Dot the yogurt with the stewed berries and use a butter knife to swirl.","6. Place into the freezer and let freeze for 1 - 2 hours, or until the bars are solid enough to cut.","7. When removed from the freezer, cut into squares or bars of the desired size.","8. Let thaw for 3 - 5 minutes before enjoying."]
944.title: Frozen Yogurt Breakfast Bars

945.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Place the almonds onto a baking tray, and toast in the oven for 7 - 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until lightly golden*.","2. Add the toasted almonds to a high-powered food processor** (ideally 600W or higher) and blend on high for 5 - 7 minutes until creamy.","3. Continue to blend until smooth. Stopping too soon results in a thicker consistency. If your food processor isn't very powerful, you may need to blend it for an extra 5 minutes to achieve the desired consistency or consider adding a bit of oil to help the process along. Enjoy!"]
945.title: Homemade Almond Butter

946.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)water, ¼cup(34 g)roasted hazelnuts, ¾cup(142 g)soft Medjool dates, pits removed, ⅓cup(35 g)Dutch processed cocoa powder, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened soy milk, ¼cup(60 mL)almond butter, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 1 tsp(1 g)instant coffee granules (optional), ¼ tspsalt, ⅓cup(56 g)dairy-free dark chocolate chips, almond butter, berry chia jam, cashew butter, hazelnut butter, peanut butter, vegan nutella]
946.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). In a small bowl, combine the ground flaxseeds and water and let sit for 5 minutes to gel.","2. Meanwhile, in a food processor, add the roasted hazelnuts and blend until you achieve a coarse flour-like consistency. Add to a medium-sized mixing bowl.","3. Back to the food processor, add the dates and blend until they combine into a softball. Alternatively, you can mash with the back of a fork if the dates are soft enough.","4. Transfer the mashed dates to the mixing bowl of ground hazelnuts, add the flaxseed gel, and all the remaining ingredients. Mix until well combined.","5. Line or oil a mini muffin tin, and spoon about a tablespoon of batter into each well. Bake on the centre rack for 15-20 minutes or until the top is firm and a toothpick comes out clean.","6. Cool for a couple of minutes before removing from the tin. Top with some homemade berry chia jam and a drizzle of nut butter. Enjoy!"]
946.title: Sugar-Free Fudgy Two-Bite Brownies

947.ingredients: [2ripe bananas, 1 Tbsp(7 g)ground flaxseeds, 1cup(240 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1cup(142 g)buckwheat flour, 1 tsp(3 g)baking powder, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¼ tspsalt, ¼ tsppumpkin pie spice (optional) , almond butter, fresh berries, maple syrup, stewed berries, vegan nutella]
947.recipe: ["1. Mash the bananas in a large bowl. Add all of the remaining ingredients and stir until well combined. If your batter seems too runny, let the mixture sit for 5 minutes to thicken slightly.","2. Preheat a non-stick large pan over medium heat, and add some oil. When hot, dollop spoonfuls of batter into the pan, using the back of your spoon to shape the batter into round pancake shapes.","3. When lightly golden on the bottom, flip, and let cook on the other side.","4. Add desired toppings, and enjoy!"]
947.title: Fabulously Healthy Buckwheat Pancakes

948.ingredients: [1cup(135 g)raw blanched hazelnuts, 2 Tbsp(14 g)ground flaxseeds, 6 Tbsp(90 mL)water, 1 tsp(3 g)ground cinnamon, ½ tspsalt, 2½cups(202 g)rolled oats, divided, ¾cup(142 g)soft Medjool dates, pits removed, ½cup(120 mL)almond butter, ⅓cup(73 g)refined coconut oil, soft or melted†, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ½cup(80 g)dried cranberries, chopped, ¼cup(36 g)raw pumpkin seeds, ¼cup(27 g)raw pecans, 1.4 oz(40 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, chopped, dairy-free dark chocolate chips, dried cranberries, hemp seeds, unsweetened coconut flakes]
948.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Spread the hazelnuts onto a baking tray and roast for 8 - 10 minutes, or until lightly golden, stirring once halfway.","2. To a small bowl, add the ground flaxseeds and water. Mix and let sit for 5 minutes to gel.","3. Line or lightly grease a 9 x 13 inch (18 x 27 cm) baking dish.","4. To the food processor, add the hazelnuts, cinnamon, salt, and half of the oats. Blend into a flour.","5. Transfer to a large bowl and add the remaining oats to the bowl as well.","6. Returning to the empty food processor, add the dates and blend until a paste is formed.","7. Then add the almond butter, coconut oil, vanilla extract, and gelled flaxseeds. Blend until well combined.","8. Transfer the sticky mixture from the food processor into the large bowl with the dry ingredients. Add the cranberries, pumpkin seeds, pecans, and chocolate to the bowl as well. Mix well.","9. Transfer the mixture to the baking dish, and press down firmly to smooth out the top. If desired, press on any of the optional toppings for decoration.","10. Bake on the centre rack of the oven until lightly golden, about 14 - 17 minutes.","11. Let cool completely, before cutting into bars."]
948.title: Hazelnut Granola Breakfast Bars

949.ingredients: [8.8 oz(250 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, roughly chopped, 10.5 oz(300 g)silken tofu, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ¼ tspsalt, ½ tspinstant coffee granules (optional), chocolate shavings, fresh berries]
949.recipe: ["1. Place the chocolate in a heatproof bowl and microwave at 600W. Stop to stir every 15 seconds until fully melted. Alternatively, melt in a double boiler over the stove. Set aside to cool slightly.","2. In a blender or food processor, combine all of the ingredients, except for the chocolate, and blend until smooth.","3. While the blender is running on low, slowly add the melted chocolate and continue blending until fully combined.","4. Pour into serving cups and refrigerate for about 30 minutes or until firm.","5. Top with optional garnishes just before serving. Enjoy!"]
949.title: Thick Dark Chocolate Pudding

950.ingredients: [1 Tbsp(15 mL)vegetable oil, 1medium onion, sliced, 2cloves garlic, chopped , 3medium sweet potatoes, cut into 1 cm cubes, 2½cups(388 g)Brussels sprouts, ends trimmed, cut in half , 1½cups(255 g)uncooked quinoa, rinsed, 2¼cups(540 mL)water, 1vegetable bouillon cube, 2cups(60 g)fresh spinach, ⅓cup(43 g)roasted almonds, coarsely chopped, ¼cup(44 g)pomegranate seeds, 2 Tbsp(20 g)dried cranberries, ¼cup(60 mL)tahini, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)water, 1 tsp(6 g)miso paste, 1 tsp(5 mL)dijon mustard, ½ tspground turmeric, ½lemon, juiced, ½ tsponion powder, 1 pinchground black pepper]
950.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 430°F (220°C). Toss the oil, onion, garlic, sweet potatoes and Brussels sprouts in a baking dish or on a baking tray lined with baking paper, and bake on the middle rack of the oven until cooked to your liking, about 40 - 50 minutes*, stopping halfway to stir.","2. Add the quinoa and water to a saucepan. Crush in the bouillon cube, bring to a boil, then reduce a simmer. Partially cover and allow to cook for 15 - 20 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat, fluff with a fork, and cover for an additional 5 - 10 minutes.","3. Add the sauce ingredients to a bowl and whisk until smooth.","4. To a bowl, add the greens, quinoa, and baked veggies. Sprinkle on the almonds, pomegranate seeds, and cranberries. Drizzle on the sauce and enjoy!"]
950.title: Autumn Glow Nourish Bowl

951.ingredients: [2 Tbsp(30 mL)maple syrup, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)melted refined coconut oil†, ⅛ tspsalt, 1 pinchcayenne pepper (optional), 2cups(276 g)raw almonds, 2 Tbsp(16 g)raw sesame seeds]
951.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). In a medium bowl, mix together the maple syrup, coconut oil, salt, and cayenne.","2. Then add in the nuts and toss to coat. Transfer to a parchment-lined baking tray, and roast on the middle rack of the oven for 5 minutes.","3. Then remove from the oven, add the sesame seeds, toss to coat, and roast for another 5 - 7 minutes, or until lightly golden. The nuts continue to cook a little after being taken out of the oven and the mixture may still look wet but it will harden as it cools. Enjoy!"]
951.title: Candied Sesame Almonds

952.ingredients: [1ripe banana, ½cup(48 g)almond flour, ¼cup(60 mL)unsweetened applesauce, 3 Tbsp(21 g)ground flaxseeds, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter, 1 Tbsp(10 g)whole chia seeds, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, ½ tspbaking soda, ½ tspground cinnamon, ¼ tspsalt, 1¼cups(101 g)rolled oats, 2 Tbsp(18 g)raw pumpkin seeds (optional), ½cup(75 g)fresh or frozen blueberries, 1.4 oz(40 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, chopped]
952.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Add the banana to a large bowl and mash well.","2. Then add in the almond flour, applesauce, flaxseeds, almond butter, chia seeds, vanilla, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Mix well.","3. Then stir in the oats and pumpkin seeds.","4. Finally, gently fold in the blueberries and chocolate.","5. Form small balls out of the dough and place them on a parchment-lined baking tray. Gently press down each ball to create a cookie shape, as these cookies don't spread on their own.","6. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 13 - 15 minutes, or until lightly golden.","7. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely. Enjoy!"]
952.title: One-Bowl Blueberry Almond Breakfast Cookies

953.ingredients: [1cup(190 g)soft Medjool dates, pits removed, ½cup(120 mL)tahini, 3 Tbsp(45 mL)water, 3cups(243 g)rolled oats, ½cup(72 g)raw almonds, roughly chopped, ½cup(65 g)raw cashews, roughly chopped, ½cup(80 g)raisins, ¼cup(40 g)dried cranberries, ¼cup(31 g)raw sunflower seeds, ¼cup(36 g)raw pumpkin seeds, ¼cup(19 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, ½ tspground cinnamon, ¼ tspsalt (optional)]
953.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C). Add the dates, tahini, and water to a small food processor and blend on high until creamy.","2. Add all the remaining ingredients to a large bowl and mix.","3. Add the date mixture to the bowl and mix to combine.","4. Spread the granola evenly on lined baking tray. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, stopping one or two times to stir to prevent burning and to ensure the granola cooks evenly.","5. When the granola is lightly golden, remove from the oven and let cool on the baking tray. When fully cooled, transfer to an airtight container or large glass storage jar. Enjoy!"]
953.title: Healthiest Ever Granola

954.ingredients: [2medium raw beets, peeled, quartered, ½cup(85 g)uncooked quinoa, rinsed , 1cup(240 mL)water, ½vegetable bouillon cube, 1½cups(246 g)cooked chickpeas, 3cups(60 g)arugula, 1orange, peeled, sliced into thin rounds, 1orange, zested, juiced, 1clove garlic, crushed , 2 Tbsp(30 mL)tahini, 1 tsp(2 g)freshly grated ginger, 1 pinchground black pepper, or more to taste, sliced roasted almonds]
954.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C). Wrap the quartered beetroots in foil and bake on the middle rack of the oven until soft, about 30 minutes. Allow cooling before cutting into bite-sized pieces. Alternatively, steam the beetroots on the stove until soft. Skip this step, if using canned or pre-cooked beets.","2. In a saucepan on high heat, add the quinoa, water, and bouillon. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook uncovered until the quinoa has absorbed all the water, about 15 minutes. When cooked, fluff with a fork, remove the heat, cover with a lid, and let rest for 5 minutes.","3. Make the dressing by adding all the ingredients to a bowl. Mix well.","4. Add the chickpeas to the saucepan with the quinoa, pour the dressing over top, and toss to combine.","5. To serve, start with the arugula as a base, top with quinoa and chickpea mixture, and garnish with the orange slices and roasted beetroots. Enjoy!"]
954.title: Beetroot Quinoa Salad with an Orange Ginger Dressing

955.ingredients: [1frozen banana, 1orange, peeled , ¾cup(180 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1 Tbsp(15 mL)almond butter]
955.recipe: ["1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth. Serve and enjoy immediately."]
955.title: Orange 'Creamsicle' Smoothie

956.ingredients: [14.1 oz(400 g)dairy-free dark chocolate, ⅓cup(43 g)roasted almonds, chopped, 3 Tbsp(30 g)dried cranberries, chopped, 2 Tbsp(18 g)roasted pumpkin seeds, 2 Tbsp(10 g)toasted coconut flakes, 2 tsp(4 g)dried goji berries, chopped]
956.recipe: ["1. Place a layer of baking paper on the bottom of two 5 x 7 inch (13 x 19 cm) baking dishes.","2. Melt the chocolate in a microwave or on the stove, using a double boiler. Let the chocolate cool off a bit.","3. Pour half of the melted chocolate between the prepared dishes, and use the back of a rubber spatula to evenly distribute the chocolate into a thin layer.","4. Distribute the almonds, cranberries, and pumpkin seeds on top of the chocolate layer.","5. Drizzle the remaining half of the chocolate over top, \"sandwiching\" the almonds and cranberries in the middle of the chocolate layers. Using a rubber spatula to even out the top.","6. Sprinkle the top with toasted coconut flakes, goji berries, and any other desired toppings. Place in the fridge or freezer for 10 - 20 minutes to harden.","7. Cut into pieces if desired, and enjoy!"]
956.title: Dark Chocolate Trail Mix Bars

957.ingredients: [1cup(150 g)frozen blueberries, 2frozen bananas, 2cups(480 mL)unsweetened soy milk†, 1 tsp(5 mL)pure vanilla extract, 2 Tbsp(30 mL)almond butter (optional)]
957.recipe: ["1. Blend all of the ingredients in a blender until smooth.","2. Serve and enjoy immediately."]
957.title: Vibrant Blueberry Vanilla Smoothie

958.ingredients: [1cup(143 g)raw almonds, 1cup(130 g)raw cashews, ⅛ tspsalt, 1cup(160 g)soft dates, pits removed , 2limes, zested, juiced , 1cup(75 g)unsweetened shredded coconut, ¾cup(120 g)dried cranberries, chopped, lime zest, unsweetened coconut flakes]
958.recipe: ["1. In a food processor, blend the almonds, cashews, and salt into a coarse flour. Empty into a large bowl.","2. To the emptied food processor, add the dates, lime zest, lime juice, and shredded coconut and blend until a smooth paste is formed.","3. Transfer the date paste to the large bowl as well, along with the dried cranberries. Mix.","4. Scoop up some of the mixture and roll it into little balls. Roll in a coating, if desired, and enjoy!"]
958.title: Cranberry Lime Bliss Balls

959.ingredients: [1 cup almond or any milk, 1 scoop vanilla protein, 2 tablespoons chia seeds, 1/2 cup berries like raspberries and blackberries]
959.recipe: ["1. Mix the milk and protein powder with a frother or in a blender. ","2. Stir in chia seeds and refrigerate 15 minutes.","3. Top with berries and enjoy!"]
959.title: 15-Minute Protein Chia Seed Cereal

960.ingredients: [1/2 cup lite coconut milk, 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk, 3/4 cup fresh ripe champagne mango, diced, 4 tbsp chia seeds, 1 tbsp sweetened shredded coconut, 4-6 drops Nu-Naturals liquid stevia, or monk fruit, sugar/honey to taste]
960.recipe: ["1. Combine all ingredients in a large container. Mix well and let it sit 30 minutes, then mix again. Refrigerate overnight or at least 5-6 hours, until the seeds expand and thicken. ","2. Divide into 2 bowls or glass dishes and serve. Enjoy!"]
960.title: Mango Coconut Chia Pudding

961.ingredients: [¾ cup low fat cottage cheese, I like Good Culture, 1/4 cup each blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, sliced strawberries, 2 tablespoons slivered almonds, drizzle of honey or maple syrup, optional]
961.recipe: ["1. Put cottage cheese in a small bowl and top with berries.","2. Add slivered almonds and honey or maple syrup if using."]
961.title: Berry Cottage Cheese Breakfast Bowl

962.ingredients: [coconut or olive oil spray, 1 large ripe banana, about 1 cup mashed, 1/2 cup plain unsweetened nondairy milk, such as almond or oat, 2 tablespoons pure maple syrup, 1 cup old-fashioned oats, (80 g) , 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, 1 tablespoons chopped pecans, divided, 1 tablespoon unsweetened shredded coconut, 2 tablespoons chopped dates or raisins, optional, 2 tablespoons chia seeds, Chopped pecans, Ground cinnamon]
962.recipe: ["1. Pour 1 1/2 cups water into the Instant Pot.","2. Oil a 6 1/2- to 7-inch round metal, glass, ceramic, or stoneware baking pan. (I used the one I bought for my air fryer)","3. In a large bowl, mash the banana very well until there are no lumps. Add the milk and maple syrup and mix until well combined.","4. In a separate bowl, mix together the oats, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, 1 1/2 teaspoons of the pecans, the coconut, dates or raisins, if using, and chia seeds.","5. Add to the mashed banana and mix to combine. ","6. Transfer the batter to the prepared pan and even it out with a spatula. Sprinkle with cinnamon and place the pan on a trivet or rack.","7. Cover with foil and then lower the trivet into the Instant Pot.","8. Lock the lid into place, set the Pressure Release Knob to Sealing, cook at high pressure 35 minutes.","9. Once the cooking cycle is done, let the pressure release naturally. Using silicone mini mitts, carefully remove the trivet with the pan and allow to cool for 15 minutes.","10. Use a knife to loosen the sides and slice into 4 pieces.","11. Top with the remaining chopped pecans and cinnamon, and serve. The bars can be stored, refrigerated in a closed container, for up to 5 days."]
962.title: Instant Pot Baked Oatmeal Bars

963.ingredients: [1 medium banana, sliced, 1/3 cup quick or rolled oats, 1/4 cup raspberries, 1/4 cup blueberries, 1 tablespoon chopped almonds, 1 teaspoon chia seeds, 1 tablespoon creamy peanut butter, melted 30 to 60 seconds in the microwave.]
963.recipe: ["1. Mash half of the banana with a fork.","2. Combine 2/3 cup water, oats and the mashed banana in a small saucepan.","3. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the oats have thickened and softened, about 1 to 5 minutes, depending on the oats you use.","4. Transfer to a bowl and top with the remaining banana sliced, raspberries, blueberries, almonds and chia seeds then drizzle with the melted peanut butter."]
963.title: Peanut Butter Breakfast Oatmeal Bowl

964.ingredients: [1 2/3 cups  from 3 medium very ripe bananas, 1 cup almond flour, 1/3 cup coconut flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 2 tbsp butter, softened, 1/3 cup unpacked brown sugar, divided, 2 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 4 ounces reduced fat cream cheese]
964.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Line cupcake tin with liners.","2. Mash bananas in a bowl, set aside.","3. In a medium bowl, combine almond flour, coconut flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt with a wire whisk. Set aside.","4. In a large bowl cream butter and 1/4 cup of the sugar with an electric mixer.","5. Add eggs, bananas and vanilla; beat at medium speed until thick. Scrape down sides of the bowl. ","6. Add flour mixture, then blend at low speed until just combined.","7. Mix the cream cheese and remaining sugar.","8. Pour half the batter into muffin pan then add about 2 teaspoons of cream cheese to the center of each muffin and top with the remaining batter; bake on the center rack for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. "]
964.title: Cream Cheese-Filled Almond Flour Banana Muffins (Gluten-Free)

965.ingredients: [1/4 cup almond, oat or milk of your choice, 2/3 cup frozen blueberries, put your blueberries in the freezer!, 2/3 cup sliced strawberries, frozen, 1 scoop vanilla protein powder, 1 tbsp peanut butter, Optional toppings: 1 tablespoon melted peanut butter for drizzling,, blueberries, chia seeds]
965.recipe: ["1. Place your milk into the blender.","2. Add frozen fruit, protein powder and 1 tablespoon peanut butter. Seal and blend until smooth.","3. Pour out into a bowl.","4. If using, melt the remaining peanut butter in the microwave 30 to 45 seconds and drizzle over the bowl.","5. Add desired toppings. Eat right away with a spoon!"]
965.title: Protein PB & J Smoothie Bowl

966.ingredients: [1 tbsp sesame oil, divided, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1 -1/2 teaspoons fresh ginger, 1 12 ounce package Palmini (hearts of palm) linguini, 1 tbsp low sodium soy sauce, or liquid aminos for whole30, 1 teaspoon sriracha, 1-1/2 cups baby spinach, 1 tablespoon peanut butter, or almond butter for whole30, 1 large egg, sesame seeds, for topping, scallions, for garnish]
966.recipe: ["1. In a large nonstick skillet heat 1/2 tablespoon oil, add the garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant, 30 seconds.","2. Add the hearts of palm noodles and stir.","3. Add 1 tbsp soy sauce, sriracha, and stir cook 1 minute, add spinach and cook until wilted, 2 to 3 minutes then push to one side.","4. Add peanut butter on the other side and leave until melted, about 30 seconds then mix all together.","5. Push everything to the side.","6. Add remaining oil on the other side and crack the egg, scramble then mix all together.","7. Transfer to a bowl, top with more sriracha, sesame seeds and scallions."]
966.title: Hearts of Palm Noodle Peanut Stir Fry

967.ingredients: [1 cup 1% milk, buttermilk or almond milk, 1 cup unbleached all purpose or whole wheat flour, 1 ripe banana, 2 large eggs, 1 teaspoon oil, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 2 teaspoons baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, cooking spray, 1 cup fresh mixed berries, for topping, 1 large banana, sliced, optional whipped cream and colored sprinkles, for topping]
967.recipe: ["1. Add milk, flour, 1 of the bananas, eggs, oil, vanilla, baking powder and salt to a blender and pulse until smooth and throughly mixed.","2. Pour pancake batter into a condiment squeeze bottle. (Or use a ziplock bag and cut a tiny whole in the corner as well.)","3. Heat pan to medium high heat and spray with oil.","4. Squeeze little small pancake dots the size of a nickel and cook until top is dry and forms bubbles.","5. Toss the pancakes with a spatula and cook for a few more minutes.","6. Occasionally toss the pancakes around to help cook more evenly until slightly browned.","7. Transfer to 4 bowls and add sliced bananas, fresh berries and your favorite toppings (I like to drizzle honey)."]
967.title: Banana Pancake Cereal

968.ingredients: [1 cup unsweetened almond/coconut milk beverage, used Almond Breeze, 3/4 cup fresh blueberries, blackberries and raspberries, 2 tbsp chia seeds, 5-6 drops Nu-Naturals liquid stevia, or sugar/honey to taste]
968.recipe: ["1. Combine the Almond Breeze almond-coconut milk together with the chia seeds and fruit in a glass jar with a lid.","2. Cover and shake well, set aside for 15 minutes.","3. Give it another good shake then refrigerate overnight or at least 5-6 hours.","4. Divide into 2 bowls or glass serving dishes and serve.","5. Enjoy!"]
968.title: Superfood Triple Berry Chia Pudding

969.ingredients: [½ cup fresh or frozen blueberries, ½ cup frozen mango chunks, ¼ teaspoon lime zest, ½ cup organic plain fat free Stonyfield yogurt, 6 almonds, or 1 tablespoon almond butter, ¾ cup almond milk, or milk of choice, 1 handful ice, 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon, optional]
969.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth."]
969.title: Tropical Mango Blueberry Lassi

970.ingredients: [Olive oil spray, 10 ounces from 1 small butternut squash, cut into ½-inch cubes, 1 teaspoon olive oil, ¼ teaspoon kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste, 10 medium Lacinato kale leaves, stems removed, thinly sliced, 2 cups baby arugula, 2 tablespoons chopped basil, 1 small pear, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces (I used D’anjou), 1 cup shredded purple cabbage, 2 tablespoons sliced almonds, toasted, 1 ounce crumbled bleu cheese, 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, 1 teaspoon honey, ½ teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1 teaspoon water, Pinch kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste]
970.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Spray a medium sheet pan with oil, add the squash, oil, salt and pepper and toss to coat. ","2.  Roast for 20-25 minutes, tossing halfway through, until fork tender and browned on the edges.","3. Meanwhile, make the dressing. In a small bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients until emulsified and combined. Set aside.","4. In 2 shallow bowls, combine the squash, kale, arugula and basil. Toss to combine. ","5.  Top each with ½ the pear, ½ cup cabbage, 1 tablespoon almonds and ½ ounce bleu cheese. ","6. Top each with 2 tablespoons dressing and serve."]
970.title: Kale and Butternut Squash Salad with Pears and Almonds

971.ingredients: [1 large garlic clove, grated or finely minced, 1 small shallot, minced, Juice of 1 lemon, 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 1 teaspoon pure maple syrup, Kosher salt to taste, Freshly ground black pepper to taste, 1 bunch lacinato kale, center ribs removed, leaves finely chopped, ¼ cup sliced almonds, 1 cup cooked quinoa, ¼ cup dried cranberries, 2 tablespoons grated or shaved Parmesan cheese]
971.recipe: ["1. Combine all of the ingredients for the dressing in a large bowl and set aside while you prep the kale. (This will soften the shallots and allow the flavors to get friendly).","2. Add the chopped kale to the bowl with the dressing. Massage the kale in handfuls—literally rub the leaves between your fingers—for a minute or two, until the leaves soften and darken in color. (Yes, I know giving your salad a rubdown is a little weird, but it’s worth it. DO NOT SKIP THIS STEP.) Briefly set aside.","3. Toast the almonds. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. (Do not put any oil in the pan!) Add the almonds to the pan and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, shaking the pan regularly, until golden brown and fragrant. Immediately transfer to a small bowl.","4. Add the quinoa, along with half of the almonds and half of the cranberries to the kale and toss to combine.","5. Transfer your salad to a serving platter or plates, top with the remaining almonds and cranberries, and sprinkle with the cheese."]
971.title: Kale Salad with Quinoa and Cranberries

972.ingredients: [2 large ripe bananas, (the riper the better) sliced into 1/2″ pieces, 1 1/2 cup diced and peeled ripe pears, 1-/2 inch dice, 5 tablespoons pure maple syrup, 1 cup uncooked quick oats*, 5 tablespoons chopped walnuts, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp cinnamon, pinch of salt, 1 cup fat-free milk, or dairy-free milk such as almond or soy, 1 large egg, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, *check labels for gluten-free]
972.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 375° Lightly spray a 8 x 8″ or 9 x 9″ ceramic baking dish with cooking spray; set aside.","2. Arrange the banana slices in a single layer on the bottom of the ceramic dish. Top with the pears, 1/4 teaspoon of the cinnamon, 2 tablespoon of the maple and cover with foil. ","3. Bake 20 minutes, until the bananas get soft.","4. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine the oats, half of the walnuts, baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, and salt; stir together.","5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining maple syrup, milk, egg, and vanilla extract.","6. Remove the fruit from the oven, then pour the oat mixture over the baked fruit.","7. Pour the milk mixture over the oats, making sure to distribute the mixture as evenly as possible over the oats. ","8. Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon and walnuts over the the top.","9. Bake the oatmeal for about 35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the oatmeal has set. Serve warm from the oven."]
972.title: Baked Oatmeal

973.ingredients: [16 ounces 3 cups raw almonds, walnuts or pecans*, 1/4 teaspoon salt, Optional: ½ teaspoon vanilla extract, Optional to taste: ground cinnamon, Optional to taste: maple syrup or honey]
973.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350F. Spread the almonds, walnuts or pecans on a large, rimmed baking sheet and toast the almonds about 10 minutes, mixing halfway. (Don’t let them get dark).","2. Let them cool about 10 minutes when they are warm, not hot.","3. Transfer the nuts to a high-speed blender or food processor. Blend until creamy, scraping down the sides as necessary. Be patient, it may seem like it will never turn to butter, but it will! It will go from clumps, to a ball against the side of the food processor (keep scraping the sides), then finally it will turn very creamy. If the mixture gets too hot, stop and let it cool down for a few minutes.","4. Once the nut butter is very creamy, blend in the salt. If you wish to add additional flavors such as vanilla, cinnamon or honey, let the mixture cool, add the optional add ins and blend until creamy once again. Keep in mind, the texture will harden slightly if you add honey or maple syrup.","5. Let the nut butter cool to room temperature, then transfer the mixture to a glass jar and tighten the lid. Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 to 4 weeks, or until you see any signs of spoilage."]
973.title: How To Make Nut Butter

974.ingredients: [3 tablespoons 25 g peanut butter (or almond butter), divided, 1 cup 240 ml almond milk, 1 cup 150 g frozen strawberries, 1 small banana, pinch of ginger, 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 2 teaspoons pure maple syrup, sliced straberries or bananas, slivered almonds, chia seeds or flax seeds, drizzle of maple syrup, drizzle of almond or coconut milk]
974.recipe: ["1. In a blender, add 2 tablespoons of the nut butter, almond milk, strawberries, banana, ginger, cinnamon, honey or maple syrup and blend until smooth and pour into 2 serving bowls.","2. In a small microwave-safe bowl, melt the remaining tablespoon nut butter in the microwave for 30 seconds or less. Whisk and drizzle over each bowl.","3. Top the bowls with your desired toppings."]
974.title: Strawberry Peanut Butter Swirl Smoothie Bowls

975.ingredients: [1 ½ cups reduced sodium chicken or vegetable broth, 1 cup dry whole wheat couscous, Lundberg brown rice couscous for GF, ¾ cup roughly chopped radishes, 2 scallions, chopped, 3 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley, ½ cup raisins, 12 grape tomatoes, halved , 1/3 cup sliced almonds , 3 tablespoons chopped fresh mint , 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, ½ teaspoon Kosher salt, Freshly ground black pepper, to taste]
975.recipe: ["1. In a small saucepan, bring chicken broth to a simmer.","2. Add the couscous and cook gently until the broth is absorbed, approximately 3 minutes.","3. Remove from heat, fluff with a fork and transfer to large bowl.","4. To the bowl, add the radishes, scallions, parsley, raisins, tomatoes, almonds, mint, lemon juice and olive oil and toss to coat.","5. Season with salt and pepper, gently toss again, taste and adjust the flavorings and seasonings as desired, and serve. "]
975.title: Houston’s Couscous Salad

976.ingredients: [1 1/2 cups quick gluten free oats, 1 cup unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 cup brown sugar, packed, 2 tbsp honey, 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce, 2 large egg whites, 1 tbsp coconut or canola oil, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 2/3 cup Bobs Red Mill Gluten Free All Purpose Flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup fresh blueberries, baking spray]
976.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a muffin tin with liners and lightly spray with oil.","2. Place oats in a food processor or chopper and pulse a few times. Soak oats in milk for about 30 minutes.","3. In a medium bowl combine brown sugar, honey, apple sauce, vanilla, egg whites, oil and mix well.","4. In a third bowl combine flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and whisk to combine.","5. Combine oats and milk with sugar, applesauce mixture and mix well.","6. Slowly add in the dry ingredients and mix until just incorporated. Fold in blueberries.","7. Spoon into the muffin tin and bake for 22-24 minutes. Enjoy!!"]
976.title: Gluten-Free, Dairy-Free, Blueberry Oatmeal Muffins

977.ingredients: [3 tablespoons chopped almonds, 3 tablespoons chopped craisins, 4 oz soft goat cheese log, cold, 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar, 1 -1/2 tablespoon cider vinegar, 2- 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon minced shallots, 1 tbsp honey, 5 oz 8 cups mixed baby greens, 1- 1/2 cups sliced strawberries]
977.recipe: ["1. Roll the cheese into 12 small balls with your hands, 1/3 oz each. In a small bowl combine the nuts and craisins. Roll the cheese in the nut mix and refrigerate until ready to eat.","2. Place all the dressing ingredients in a small bowl and whisk.","3. Combine the salad ingredients in a big salad bowl and toss with dressing or you can divide the ingredients equally between four plates."]
977.title: Berry Salad with Almond-Cranberry Crusted Goat Cheese

978.ingredients: [20 almonds, total weight 20 grams, 20 pecan halves, total weight 20 grams, 20 walnut halves, total weight 60 grams, 1 package Ghirardelli Dark Chocolate Melting Wafers*, sea salt]
978.recipe: ["1. Place chocolate wafers in a medium, microwave safe bowl. Melt in 30 second increments, stirring until melted, about 1 1/2 minutes total.","2. Working quickly, dip a walnut into the melted chocolate with a fork and shake the excess off. Transfer to a piece of wax paper. Do the same with the pecan, then lay the pecan on top of the walnut. Repeat with the almond, finishing the cluster. Repeat with the remaining nuts.","3. Finish each with a pinch of sea salt, to do this you will want to sprinkle it on top once they are are almost dry so it doesn't absorb, but not too dry or it won't stick. Enjoy!!"]
978.title: Dark Chocolate Nut Clusters with Sea Salt

979.ingredients: [1/4 cup  uncooked pre-washed quinoa, or rinse well under water, 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 tsp honey, 1 medium banana, sliced, 6 strawberries, sliced, 1/2 cup blueberries, 2 tsp hemp seeds, pepitas or nuts, 1/4 cup warmed almond milk]
979.recipe: ["1. Fill a small pot of almond milk, cinnamon and vanilla, bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, add quinoa, cover and cook on low until liquid evaporates, about 20 to 25 minutes.","2. Fluff with a fork.","3. Divide the hot quinoa in 2 bowls, top each with sliced fruit and hemp seeds, drizzle with honey and add warm milk if desired."]
979.title: Berry Quinoa Breakfast Bowls

980.ingredients: [1/4 cup quick oats*, 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk, or skim, soy, 1/2 tbsp chia seeds, 1 fresh fig, sliced, 1 tbsp chopped pecans, or any nut, 1/2 tbsp raw honey, * check labels for gluten-free.]
980.recipe: ["1. Place the oats, milk and chia seeds in a jar or a container with a lid; stir, cover and let it sit 1 to 2 hours, or refrigerate overnight.","2. Place in a bowl, (I prefer it room temp or you can heat it up) top with figs, honey and chopped nuts."]
980.title: Overnight Oats with Figs and Honey

981.ingredients: [3 large eggs, separated, at room temperature, 3 large egg whites, at room temperature, 2/3 cup sugar, 1 tsp pure vanilla extract, pinch fine sea salt, 2 cups almond flour or almond meal, (200 grams), 1 cup mixed berries, powdered sugar, for dusting (optional)]
981.recipe: ["1. Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F.","2. Grease a 9-inch spring form pan with nonstick spray, line with parchment paper, and flour (use almond meal or a gluten-free all purpose flour blend to keep the cake gluten-free).","3. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and all but 2 tbsp of the sugar.  Whisk until the yolks become thick and pale in color, about 1 minute. Whisk in the vanilla extract and the salt and set aside.","4. In the bowl of a standard electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment (or a bowl with a hand mixer), beat the 6 egg whites on medium speed until they become opaque, about 1 minute.","5. Sprinkle in the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar, and continue to beat the egg whites until they hold medium peaks.","6. With a flexible rubber spatula, stir in about 1/4 of the egg whites to the egg yolk mixture (no need to be gentle here).  Scrape the remaining egg whites over the yolks, and about half of the almond flour.","7. Gently fold them into the yolks, but only partially.","8. While the mixture still has a few streaks of white left, add the remaining almond flour and fold in, folding until you have a homogeneous batter.  Be gentle!","9. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and shimmy until the batter is level.","10. Bake the cake for about 35 minutes, until the top is golden brown and springy to the touch. Let the hot cake cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes, then run a butter knife along the edges of the cake pan.","11. Invert the cake pan onto the rack, remove the sides and bottom, and peel away the parchment paper. Turn the cake right side up and allow to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar, cut into 12 slices and serve with fresh berries."]
981.title: 5-Ingredient Almond Cake with Fresh Berries

982.ingredients: [1 cup raspberries, 1/2 cup canned lite coconut milk, 1/2 cup unsweetened Almond Breeze almond coconut milk, 2 tbsp chia seeds, 1 tbsp sweetened shredded coconut, 6 to 8 drops Nu-Naturals liquid stevia, or sugar/honey to taste, 1 tsp lime juice, 1 tsp lime zest]
982.recipe: ["1. Combine half the raspberries and the remaining ingredients in a large container.","2. Mix well and close container.","3. Refrigerate overnight or at least 5-6 hours.","4. Divide into 2 bowls or glass dishes, top with remaining berries and serve.","5.  "]
982.title: Coconut Lime Raspberry Chia Pudding

983.ingredients: [1 small peach, sliced, 1/3 cup uncooked quinoa, rinsed well, 2/3 + 3/4 cup almond milk, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 2 tsp brown sugar, or sweetener of your choice, 12 raspberries, 14 blueberries, 2 teaspoons local honey]
983.recipe: ["1. In sauce pan cook combine quinoa and 2/3 cup almond milk, vanilla and brown sugar.","2. Cook on medium heat and bring to boil for five minutes.","3. Lower the heat to low and cover.","4. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes, or until easily fluffs with a fork.","5. Meanwhile, heat a grill pan and spray with oil.","6. Grill the peaches to bring out their sweetness 2 to 3 minutes; set aside.","7. Warm the remaining almond milk.","8. Divide the cooked quinoa between 2 bowls then pour in warmed almond milk.","9. Top with peaches, raspberries and blueberries and drizzle each with 1 teaspoon of honey."]
983.title: Summer Quinoa Breakfast Bowl

984.ingredients: [1/2 medium ripe frozen banana, 6 oz Almond Breeze almond coconut milk, 3 1/2 oz about 1/2 cup fresh pineapple, 2/3 cup ice, 1 tbsp chia seeds, optional, 1 tbsp sweetened shredded coconut]
984.recipe: ["1. Place all the ingredients in the blender except for the coconut and blend until smooth.","2. Mix in coconut and pour over a glass of ice."]
984.title: Pina Banana Colada Smoothie

985.ingredients: [4 oz haas avocado, from 1 medium, 2 1/3 cups unsweetened Almond Breeze Almond Coconut milk, 6 tbsp raw sugar, or your favorite sweetener, 1/2 cup sweetened shredded coconut flakes, Baker's]
985.recipe: ["1. Combine the avocado, milk and sugar in the blender and mix until smooth.","2. Add the coconut flakes and mix to incorporate.","3. Pour into the popsicle mold and freeze."]
985.title: Avocado Coconut Popsicles

986.ingredients: [3/4 cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk, I used Almond Breeze, 1 loose cup baby spinach, 2 teaspoons peanut butter, 1/2 frozen ripe banana, 1/3 oz heaping tablespoon cacao nibs (I used Navitas), 1 cup ice, optional a few drops liquid stevia]
986.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth."]
986.title: Superfood PB Banana and Cacao Green Smoothie

987.ingredients: [3/4 cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk, Almond Breeze, 1 pitted date, 1 tbsp raw shelled hemp seeds, or seeds of your choice, 1/2 ripe medium banana, 1/2 tbsp chia seeds, 3/4 cup baby kale, or spinach, 1 cup ice]
987.recipe: ["1. Combine all the ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth."]
987.title: Kale, Banana, Chia, Hemp Superfood Smoothie

988.ingredients: [1 14 oz canned low-sodium black beans, rinsed and drained, 2 large eggs, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 3/4 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon oil, 1 tablespoon unsweetened almond milk, or dairy, skim, 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon of freshly ground coffee or instant coffee, 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, divided (Hershey's)]
988.recipe: ["1. Preheat the oven to 350° F.","2. Grease a nonstick 9 x 9-inch square baking pan with baking spray and line with parchment paper, leaving a 2-inch overhang on all sides.","3. Blend the black beans, eggs, cocoa powder, sugar, oil, almond milk, balsamic, baking soda, baking powder and coffee in the blender until smooth and pour into a bowl.","4. Fold in 1/2 cup chocolate chips until combined.","5. Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan.  Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips evenly over the top of the brownies.","6. Bake the brownies until a toothpick comes out clean, about 30 to 32 minutes.","7. Allow the brownies to cool completely before slicing them into squares."]
988.title: Amazing Flour-less Black Bean Brownies

989.ingredients: [cooking spray, 2 cups old-fashioned or quick-cooking rolled oats, gluten-Free, if needed, 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1 cup dried cranberries, chopped (by hand or in food processor), 1/2 cup unsweetened plain almond milk, I used almond breeze, 1/2 cup multigrain hot cereal, use GF, if needed (I used Bobs Red Mill 10 Grain), 1 cup natural, unsweetened almond butter, 1/2 cup pure maple syrup, 1 tsp ground cinnamon, 1/4 tsp fine sea salt, 1 tsp pure vanilla extract]
989.recipe: ["1. Preheat oven to 350°F.","2. Line a 9-inch square baking pan with foil or parchment paper and then spray with nonstick spray.","3. Spread the oats and pecans on a large rimmed baking sheet.","4. Bake in the preheated oven for 6 to 8 minutes, shaking halfway through, until golden and fragrant.","5. Transfer to a large bowl; add the chopped cranberries.","6. Bring the milk to a boil in a small saucepan set over medium heat.","7. Stir in the multi-grain cereal and remove from the heat; let stand for 2 minutes.","8. Add the nut or seed butter, maple syrup, cinnamon, and salt.","9. Cook and stir the mixture over low heat for 6 to 7 minutes or until thickened; remove from the heat and stir in vanilla extract.","10. Immediately add the cereal mixture to the oats mixture, mixing with a spatula until coated.","11. Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and flatten with the back of a measuring cup.","12.
